text:
Hi we are setting up our node-validator but are struggling a bit with the OIDC configuration and specific MS Entra ID terminology. Could someone provide a bit more context on the values. We have configured:
• 3 MS Enterprise Applications with an App registration for each (validator, wallet and cns)
• Values for the secret:
```kubectl create secret generic splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth \
    "--from-literal=ledger-api-user=VALIDATOR_APP_REGISTRATION_CLIENT_ID" \
    "--from-literal=url=<https://login.microsoftonline.com/TENANT_ID_REDACTED/v2.0/.well-known/openid-configuration>" \
    "--from-literal=client-id=VALIDATOR_APP_REGISTRATION_CLIENT_ID" \
    "--from-literal=client-secret=VALIDATOR_APP_REGISTRATION_CLIENT_ID" \
    "--from-literal=audience=<https://canton.network.global>" \
    "--from-literal=scope=<https://graph.microsoft.com/.default>" \
    -n canton-dev```

text:
Hello everyone, sorry to interrupt, but I'd like to join the discussion. I'm currently trying to register a new account on Brale, but it seems our country is not included in the list. Additionally, the phone number format used in our country consists of 12 digits, which causes an "Invalid Phone Number" error.

Is it still possible for us to register on Brale?


Thank you.

elements.text:

Additionally, the phone number format used in our country consists of 12 digits, which causes an "Invalid Phone Number" error.

text:
Hey all, Brale supports onramping and offramping stablecoins on Canton. U.S. businesses can signup at <https://app.brale.xyz/signup>

Unfortunately we don't support non U.S. at this time.

text: <https://docs.dev.sync.global/release_notes.html#id2>

```Deployments

Validator, app and scan support specifying a scope when requesting the token from the participant. This enables use of IAMs that make the scope parameter mandatory.```

text: I have a question about the 3.3 upgrade and the @daml/ledger library - the interface to the library is high enough level that the change in <https://docs.digitalasset.com/build/3.3/reference/lapi-migration-guide?_gl=1*124i7x3*_gcl_au*NzAyNTk2NjQ4LjE3NDE3MTIwOTQ.*_ga*ODE4NDA5MTYuMTcyMzI0MTc5Nw..*_ga_GVK9ZHZSMR*czE3NDgzNzEyMjkkbzQyJGcwJHQxNzQ4MzcxMjI5JGo2MCRsMCRoMCRkX0I0RmhtLV9NdW1mdEV3bVBEemxTamI3TWNSbkZLSFN5Zw..&_ga=2.168527266.2027810370.1748371230-81840916.1723241797#application-id-to-user-id-rename|https://docs.digitalasset.com/build/3.3/reference/lapi-migration-guide?_gl=1*124i7x3*_g[…]&_ga=2.168527266.2027810370.1748371230-81840916.1723241797> doesn't seem to impact our inputs, but it's not clear if the change would impact the @daml/ledger implementation (and thus we'd need to upgrade @daml/ledger to the version for 3.3) or if the change is encapsulated by the JSON API and handled in the layer that converts the JSON API requests to the underlying grpc requests.

elements.text: I have a question about the 3.3 upgrade and the @daml/ledger library - the interface to the library is high enough level that the change in
https://docs.digitalasset.com/build/3.3/reference/lapi-migration-guide?_gl=1*124i7x3*_g[…]&_ga=2.168527266.2027810370.1748371230-81840916.1723241797

doesn't seem to impact our inputs, but it's not clear if the change would impact the @daml/ledger implementation (and thus we'd need to upgrade @daml/ledger to the version for 3.3) or if the change is encapsulated by the JSON API and handled in the layer that converts the JSON API requests to the underlying grpc requests.

text:
Hi all,

On May 28 13:00UTC, DevNet is going to upgrade to Splice 0.4.0/Canton 3.3 . The global synchronizer will be down.

After the upgrade you will need to follow this <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html#validator-upgrades> to upgrade your node. The migration ID will be posted tomorrow as well for your node to upgrade to.

The version 0.4.0 is available on Github <https://github.com/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/releases/tag/v0.4.0>
